medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute cholecystitis with fever and increased swelling in left lower extremity (LLE).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented to the ED with fever and increased swelling in the left leg, which occurred after he experienced diarrhea, followed by fever and shaking chills after work. The swelling was above baseline and developed in the morning. The patient continued to feel unwell until EMS brought him in. Initial vital signs in the ED showed fever and hypotension. Symptoms progressed to significant abdominal pain requiring treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV/AIDS, Kaposi Sarcoma, previous treatment for Streptococcus Mitis infection.
medical_history.family_history: Grandmother with diabetes mellitus; parents and siblings healthy.
